alert.note: Alert for Municipality of Skagway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 27 at 10:11AM AKDT until September 30 at 10:00AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The following area, Taiya River. * WHEN...Until 700 PM AKDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of the Taiya River and other low-lying areas is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1000 AM AKDT, Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain fell near sea level the last two days. Little to no additional rainfall is expected and river levels will continue to steadily fall through Tuesday. - Areas along low lying portions of the Chilkoot Trail is the most likely place to experience flooding. - For Taiya River near Skagway: At 9:00am the stage was 16.85 feet. Flood Stage is 16.5 feet. Forecast: A steady decrease through the day, falling below flood stage. Impacts: At 16.8 feet: Portions of the first few miles of the Chilkoot Trail will begin to inundate with water to ankle depth.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
